creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Makiji Hase
inscription: Image 1: [Ten thousand miles of sky open over the vast waters, / Clouds and mist boil up over this isle of the immortals; / While a man gathering fungus of the immortals leans on a tall pine, / White cranes sing in the rising sun. Shinten'ō] (SA);  Image 2: [the good fortune clouds of longevity color cover hanging over your family painted and inscribed by Shinten'ō] (SM)
markings: image 1: URC, oval relief: [ 萬里天開積水雲霞涌處之蓬瀛釆芝人倚長松立皓鶴聲中紅旭生 信天翁] ; L center, square intaglio; L center, square relief; LLQ, square relief; image 2: URC, rectangular relief; URQ, square intaglio; URQ, square relief; LLQ, square intaglio: [ 瑞雲壽色繞君家 信天翁画題]
medium: Hanging scroll, ink and color on crepe paper
signed: image 1, L: [ 信天翁 ]; image 2, URQ: [ 信天翁画題 ]
title: Pine and Poem Gifts
